title: load .rerun file from $HOME and project directory in case it exists
body:
Now it loads the .rerun file from the project directory and $HOME in case it exists
Command line arguments have precedence over the params declared in the project
Params declared in the project directory have precedence over the params in the $HOME directory

repo.name: rerun
repo.description: Restarts an app when the filesystem changes. Uses growl and FSEventStream if on OS X.

repo.name: rerun
repo.description: Restarts an app when the filesystem changes. Uses growl and FSEventStream if on OS X.

title: add --ignore-dotfiles and disable ignoring by default
body:
I added an option to enable the filtering of dotfiles. It's disabled by default, because otherwise it's impossible with the current setup to detect changes to them (because of the order in which Listen finds & filters files).

If you think it should be enabled by default though, I'm open to changing this though.

title: Add feature files to default pattern and update README
body:
`xxx.feature` files are commonly used for Gherkin based stuff, e.g. Cucumber or Turnip feature tests.

I also noticed that your README wasn't up2date and fixed it.

repo.name: rerun
repo.description: Restarts an app when the filesystem changes. Uses growl and FSEventStream if on OS X.

title: support OSX notifications as alternative to growl
body:
I have coded the OSX Notifications support for rerun. It uses [terminal-notifier](https://github.com/alloy/terminal-notifier) gem. And you can use it with two different arguments: `-on` or `--osx-notifications`. If you will use it will disable the growl notifications.

Related to issue: #33

How it looks? See here: ![OS X notifications for rerun gem](http://f.cl.ly/items/1q302F041i2I0j1l113U/Screen%20Shot%202013-06-14%20o%2012.11.40.png)

repo.name: rerun
repo.description: Restarts an app when the filesystem changes. Uses growl and FSEventStream if on OS X.

title: Add restart signal support
body:
This can be used when running with unicorn.

rerun -r HUP -- unicorn -c unicorn.rb

NOTE: Make sure you run unicorn with a config file
      otherwise it will respawn the master and you will
      end up in a very bad place.
